subject: Re: [junit] JSP Validation (Was: HTML/XHTML Validation w/JUnit)
msgSnippet: ... I think the second one is called a valid document. So a Valid XML document is Well Formed and is Schema/DTD conformant . - Yagiz Erkan -
messageBody:
> "well-formed XML" meaning all the tags open and close properly, and so on.
> "DTD/XML schema conformant" meaning that the document conforms to a
> DTD/XML schema.

I think the second one is called a "valid" document. So a "Valid" XML document
is "Well Formed" and is "Schema/DTD conformant".

- Yagiz Erkan -
http://yagiz.blogspot.com
http://www.erkans.com
